intro: Psychotria clementis, commonly known as the Clement's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red or orange when mature. Psychotria clementis is often used in traditional medicine and is also of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
